result.execSummary:
The defendant Crista J Carver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct Ordinance Violation. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $100 fine plus all associated costs 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice
Stipulation and Order to Amend /s/ TTF 10/10/18  **AMENDED TO PORTAGE COUNTY ORDINANCE 2.1.1 - DISORDERLY CONDUCT

Defendant Crista J Carver in court with Attorney (Atty) Patricia A. Baker. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests to amend this case down to ordinance: 2.1.1 and forfeiture $100 + court costs. Court takes no action in court today. Parties to contact Branch 3.
Atty Patricia Baker appointed
Adjourned initial appearance on October 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crista J Carver in court.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:06 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court questions if the defendant spoke to the public defender. 
Defendant indicates she has not heard who was appointed. 

Defendant asks for adjourning the matter for a month. 
Atty Wetzsteon makes statements to the court.  Two weeks should be plenty of time. 

Atty Katena Roberts-Turner is present.  She spoke with Atty Ryan Drengler, she does qualify for representation, have contacted over 100 attorneys to no avail.  Private bar attorney pay is the issue. 
Court will set the matter for a month out.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 4, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crista J Carver in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender . 
Bond is continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 4, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Crista J Carver
Current: W12879 County Road O, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States  (Effective: 08-20-2018)
Prior: 476 Sequatchia Lane, Sequatchia, TN 37374 United States
Initial appearance on August 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Not to have violent or abusive contact with the victim referenced in the complaint or contact with any place that child resides or any person that child resides with. 
Maintain residence with her mother and stepfather during the pendency of her bond unless she is specifically permitted to change residence. 
At the time the bond is posted and signed, provide the mailing address of her place of residence with her mother and her stepfather.

Defendant Crista J Carver appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:29 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Mukoski reviews the warrant status of the case.  
Atty Drengler indicates the defendant does qualify for public defender representation and counsel will be appointed. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed.  Matter will be set for initial appearance. 

Atty Drengler reached out to her mom and step-father but wasn't able to get ahold of them.  

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.  
Court questions Atty Mukoski re: arrest in Tennessee. 
Atty Mukoski indicates she was not extradicted at that time. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  Her mother sent her to TN to where she had previously provided.  She was told that her attorney would arrange for a phone appearance.  She sat for 8 days on the warrant.  She turned herself in to resolve this.  She will be living with her mother and stepfather until the case is resolved.  Is currently unemployed and has no money to post.  Her stepdad may be helping her with that.  Neither parent was able to be reached for the time change in the hearing today. Asks for a signature bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion to Withdraw as Counsel with attached Order Permitting Atty Eric Sheets to Withdraw as Counsel /s/ TTF 09/21/17
Body only - cc:da w/minutes ss 11-04-15 - Judge reprinted with GEO restrictions marked 11/11/15
Body only

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:36 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins makes statements re: review of the case.  Defendant has moved to TN.  New address was provided.  Matter was adjourned to new date. 
Atty Sheets makes statements.  Has spoken to his client.  She is 17 years old and in high school.  She has no way to physically be here.  She could try to be available by phone.  Intends to meet with the ADA to try to resolve.  
Atty Cousins asks for a criminal warrant.  If some arrangement can be worked out by the parties, that would be fine. 
Atty Sheets asks for a neighboring-state warrant only.  Makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court issues a criminal warrant.  Body Only.  

Atty Sheets asks for 48 to 72 hours before that is issued.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will hold the warrant for 72 hours.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-26-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:21 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court reviews the file. 

Atty Cousins states affidavit of mailing, sent to last known address and not returned to the DA. 
Atty Sheets indicates on 10/6/15, submitted a change of address to the Clerks office.  Attempted to call the defendant and left voicemail.  She tried to contact him outside of office hours.  
Atty Cousins requests a warrant. 
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court.  Asks to adjourn for 2 weeks. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn for 2 weeks.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
